page.title: 07INFLUENCES ON FARMING
page.content: & pigeons during the winter months. BUSH HALL FARM:{499093}The house dates from 1600. The present owner S.Padfield has farmed the 450 acres since 1968.No livestock are kept now due to restrictions imposed by the European Economic Community. The farm employs 3 men ; in earlier times 50 to 60 were needed at harvest times. Employees live in tied cottages. There seems to be a general resentment of E.C.C.dictates & the remote bureaucracy restricting freedom of choice in the farming world. BUSH HALL is operated as one unit in a complex covering 1600 acres. Machine operations are powered by a range of 4-wheel drive tractors from 100 to 250 horse-power costing from Â£22 to Â£55000
